markdownRemark.excerpt: Previously I used R’s BlogDown. But recently I used Python more and would like to switch a more general tool. The static site built by Gastby, which is powered…
markdownRemark.html:
Previously I used R’s BlogDown. But recently I used Python more and would like to switch a more general tool. The static site built by Gastby, which is powered by React, is pretty fast. So I decided to give a try. Here is the workflow of blogging:

  1. In the project folder, enter: gatsby develop
  2. Add new markdown file in the content/blog. I will prefer to build folder for each post, and compose a index.md inside the folder.
  3. To deploy, run npm run deploy

Notes:

The blog is build based on Gatsby’s blog starter.

To create the template gatsby new my-blog-starter https://github.com/gatsbyjs/gatsby-starter-blog.

I added code highlighting and modified the bio. I also want Table of Contents, and will add it later.

frontmatter.title: Blogging by Gastby
frontmatter.description: Try to use Gastby for blogging.
